ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=2 to 3 times a week; 5=4 to 6 times a week; 6=Daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day you are drinking?
Notes: 0=1 drink; 1=2 drinks; 2=3 drinks; 3=4 drinks; 4=5 to 6 drinks; 5=7 to 9 drinks; 6=10 or more drinks

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often do you have X (5 for men; 4 for women and men over age 65) or more drinks on one occasion?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=2 to 3 times a week; 5=4 to 6 times a week; 6=Daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often have you found that you were not able to stop drinking once you had started?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often have you failed to do what was expected of you because of drinking?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often have you needed a drink first thing in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, how often have you been unable to remember what happened the night before because you had been drinking?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than monthly; 2=Monthly; 3=Weekly; 4=Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, have you or someone else been injured because of your drinking?
Notes: 0=No; 2=Yes, but not in the past year; 4=Yes, during the past year

ElementDescription: Thinking about your drinking in the past year, has a relative, friend, doctor, or other health care worker been concerned about your drinking and suggested you cut down?

ElementDescription: How often during the past year have you failed to do what was normally expected of you because of drinking?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Less than monthly; 3 = Monthly; 4 = Two or three times per week; 5 = Four or more times per week; 999 = Prefer not to say

ElementDescription: How often in the past year have you needed a drink in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Less than monthly; 3 = Monthly; 4 = Two or three times per week; 5 = Four or more times per week; 999 = Prefer not to say

ElementDescription: How often during the past year have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Less than monthly; 3 = Monthly; 4 = Two or three times per week; 5 = Four or more times per week; 999 = Prefer not to say

ElementDescription: Have you or someone else been injured because of your drinking?
Notes: 0=No; 2=Yes, but not in the last 3 months; 4=Yes, during the last 3 months; 777=NOT APPLICABLE; 888=DON''T KNOW; 999=REFUSE; Not applicable indicates that the participant was not asked this question due to branching logic.

ElementDescription: Has a relative, friend, doctor, or other health worker been concerned about your drinking and suggested you cut down?
Notes: 0=No; 2=Yes, but not in the last 3 months; 4=Yes, during the last 3 months; 777=NOT APPLICABLE; 888=DON''T KNOW; 999=REFUSE; Not applicable indicates that the participant was not asked this question due to branching logic.

ElementDescription: AUDIT - Total Harm Score with 4 items, as defined in the official WHO AUDIT manual
Notes: Sum of items usaudit_q7 (guilt after drinking), usaudit_q8 (unable to remember), usaudit_q9 (alcohol-related injuries), and usaudit_q10 (others concerned about drinking)
